welcome.github_star: If you like Envis, give us a Star on GitHub
welcome.subtitle: A cross-platform environment management tool
welcome.rapid_setup_desc: When developing a new project, setting up the environment is often the hardest part. Download difficulties, tedious configuration, dependency errors - Envis solves these with one-click service installation, eliminating manual configuration and dependency troubleshooting, getting your project ready to run immediately.
welcome.multi_project_desc: When working on multiple projects, Project A needs Node14, Java8, MySQL, while another needs Node20, Java11, MariaDB. Switching between projects means switching environments every time, which is tedious. With Envis, switch environments with one click and easily manage complex project dependencies.
welcome.team_standardization_desc: Configuring environments on every computer is troublesome. Envis supports exporting and importing environment configurations, allowing one-click setup of identical environments. Eliminate the 'it works on my machine' problem, ensure all team members have consistent development environments, and guarantee stable project execution across different devices.
welcome.feedback_desc: Submit bug reports or feature requests
welcome.join_community_desc: Scan QR code to join Envis user community
welcome.wechat_group_desc: Add on WeChat：zhang-4696，attach with “Envis” to join group

welcome.subtitle: A powerful, easy-to-use environment management tool for developers.
welcome.new_environment_desc: Create a new isolated environment for your project.
welcome.ai_assistant_desc: Get help with your configuration and troubleshooting.
welcome.documentation_desc: Read the comprehensive guides and API references.
welcome.rapid_setup_desc: Launch complex service stacks in seconds with pre-configured templates.
welcome.multi_project_desc: Switch between different project environments seamlessly without conflict.
welcome.team_standardization_desc: Share environment configurations to ensure consistency across your team.
welcome.step_1_desc: Click the plus button to create your first isolated environment.
welcome.step_2_desc: Configure services like databases, caches, and message queues.
welcome.step_3_desc: Start your services and monitor their status in real-time.
welcome.join_community_desc: Connect with other developers and get help.
welcome.wechat_group_desc: Scan the QR code to join

node_service.prefix_set_failed: Failed to set Node.js config prefix
node_service.macos_silicon_warning_desc_1: Node.js v14 does not have an official macOS ARM64 (Apple Silicon) build, only x64. For macOS, when the system architecture is aarch64 (Apple Silicon) and the Node.js version is v14 or lower, Envis will automatically fallback to the x64 architecture package.
node_service.macos_silicon_warning_desc_2: Running x64 versions on Apple Silicon requires Rosetta 2. Please go to Finder -> Applications -> Utilities -> Terminal -> Right Click -> Get Info -> Open using Rosetta. Then reopen the terminal, and it will run in x64 architecture to ensure compatibility.
node_service.prefix_tooltip: Sets the installation location for global packages
node_service.install_global_package_desc: Enter package name to install, e.g., pnpm@7 or typescript@latest
node_service.conflict_manager_desc: The following Node.js version managers were detected: {{managers}}. These tools may conflict with this application. It is recommended to uninstall or disable them before using this application.
